Can Do: A Game of Meeseeks
A game made for nerds like me <3
I picked most of these Dragon Age books in a bundle on DriveThruRPG. I played a few, but I'm not really that sold. Maybe this is because I never got into the video games.
I picked most of these Dragon Age books in a bundle on DriveThruRPG. I played a few, but I'm not really that sold. Maybe this is because I never got into the video games.
Preview. Sadly, I don't think this is being worked on anymore.
Actually a supplement, but still pretty good on its own.
I mostly keep this for the glorious maps.
Pretty damn pretentious, but also pretty damn pretty. I might reuse the setting from this, but I doubt I'll ever use the system again, it's just not worth the effort.
My go-to system nowadays. Setting-agnostic and simple to play/run, for most settings I couldn't ask for more.
Generally not as good as Core, but sometimes the simplicity pays off.
My first foray into Fate, this is actually based on 2e. An amazing campaign game which naturally tends towards rich, detailed and realistic worlds.
Iron Edda: War of Metal and Bone
Although pretty cool in theory, I'm not sold on mixing skills and approaches.
I wrote this! Check out the project page for more information.
Fun to play, difficult to run!
War of Ashes: Fate of Agaptus
Fun, but a lot to keep in your head at one time if you wanna stay true to the setting.
Don't really need this, but I love Fiasco and wanted to support Bully Pulpit Games!
A gift from Steff when I was feeling down one day :D
Fun system, sessions are much longer than the standard 3-5h due to everyone constantly making references!
Preview. I don't think this is being worked on anymore
Got this for free from Orcs Nest. I can see why they were giving it away.
Ran this for a group online for a little while. Fun, but it tends to overcomplicate things.
St Trinians/Mean Girls... In RPG form!
I've played with the author a few times!
Preview. I was meant to help playtest this, but I never got around to it...
One of my favourites. I like to use the system for more generic surreal settings too.
Ridiculous, amazing, but the modules are what make this game. Although I want to see a summon go as wrong as possible one day.
A common intro to LotFP when I'm the one doing the introducing...
Monolith Beyond Space and Time, The
Inserted this into a high-level D&D game and the players freaked. Love it!
This makes a great Deep Run in Shadowrun. Just lethal enough to give them a sense of danger but not kill them. Different each time, too!
Tried running this once, but the players couldn't deal with it, sadly. They spent the entire session wandering around uselessly.
Fun for a oneshot, probably not for a campaign.

It's a game called Mage. And you can play a hacker. :D
I played a hacker who controlled living things via nanobots in their bloodstream.
Mage: Ascension - How do you do that?
An great resource for people, like me, who aren't that great with the system!
Sequel to Mars Colony, also pretty great
Very difficult to get your head around, but fun!
System is too complex, but there are some nice rules scattered here and there which I sometimes integrate into other things.
My all-time favourite RPG. It really saddens me that it's out of print.
Very difficult to run, but enjoyable nonetheless
A bit questionable value, but I personally find it useful
Love and Sex in the Ninth World
The Octopi of the Ninth World
The Sun Below: A City on the Edge
Close to perfect as a heist game. Definitely worth a buy.
Trying too hard to be a d% system when it's clearly a d20 system. Overall a bit of a mess. It was fun to play for a while though.
A two-player scenario I wrote, inspired by an encounter from The Monolith from Beyond Time and Space, a Lamentations of the Flame Princess module.
Really need to run this at some point!
Place to Fuck Each Other, A
The novella at the end makes this worth it even for people who don't obsessively buy rulebooks like I do :p
Portfolio of a Dragon: Dunkelzahn's Secrets
Calfree is pretty cool. If ever I run a game set in North America, I'll send them to Calfree at some point.
I was disappointed at the lack of another novella...
Gotta run this at some point!
Dawn of the Artifacts: Darkest Hour
Dawn of the Artifacts: New Dawn
Really looking forward to running this one.
Donated most of this to Imperial College Tabletop Gaming Society, but I still have a few parts.
The basis of my first SR campaign, which resulted in the destruction of London...
Got it for free, not sure it was worth the money.
Backed on Kickstarter, and glad I did!
Ran a harry potter game about gangs of wizards with this. Great fun ^^
Got it directly from the author. A small, relaxing game.
The only singleplayer RPG I've ever come across! I doubt I'll ever play it because it's very messy, but it sounds cool.
Found this online, looks great but I've yet to play/run it.
